verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> on Neginoth <WH5058>, Maschil <WH4905>, A Psalm of David <WH1732>. Give ear <WH238> to my prayer <WH8605>, O God <WH430>; and hide <WH5956> not thyself from my supplication <WH8467>.
Attend <WH7181> unto me, and hear <WH6030> me: I mourn <WH7300> in my complaint <WH7879>, and make a noise <WH1949>;

Because of the voice <WH6963> of the enemy <WH341>, because <WH6440> of the oppression <WH6125> of the wicked <WH7563>: for they cast <WH4131> iniquity <WH205> upon me, and in wrath <WH639> they hate <WH7852> me.
My heart <WH3820> is sore pained <WH2342> within <WH7130> me: and the terrors <WH367> of death <WH4194> are fallen <WH5307> upon me.
Fearfulness <WH3374> and trembling <WH7461> are come <WH935> upon me, and horror <WH6427> hath overwhelmed <WH3680> me. overwhelmed: Heb. covered
And I said <WH559>, Oh that <WH5414> I had wings <WH83> like a dove <WH3123>! for then would I fly away <WH5774>, and be at rest <WH7931>.
Lo, then would I wander <WH5074> far off <WH7368>, and remain <WH3885> in the wilderness <WH4057>. Selah <WH5542>.
I would hasten <WH2363> my escape <WH4655> from the windy <WH7307> storm <WH5584> and tempest <WH5591>.
Destroy <WH1104>, O Lord <WH136>, and divide <WH6385> their tongues <WH3956>: for I have seen <WH7200> violence <WH2555> and strife <WH7379> in the city <WH5892>.
Day <WH3119> and night <WH3915> they go about <WH5437> it upon the walls <WH2346> thereof: mischief <WH205> also and sorrow <WH5999> are in the midst <WH7130> of it.
Wickedness <WH1942> is in the midst <WH7130> thereof: deceit <WH8496> and guile <WH4820> depart <WH4185> not from her streets <WH7339>.

For it was not an enemy <WH341> that reproached <WH2778> me; then I could have borne <WH5375> it: neither was it he that hated <WH8130> me that did magnify <WH1431> himself against me; then I would have hid <WH5641> myself from him:
But it was thou, a man <WH582> mine equal <WH6187>, my guide <WH441>, and mine acquaintance <WH3045>. mine equal: Heb. according to my rank
We took sweet <WH4985> counsel <WH5475> together <WH3162>, and walked <WH1980> unto the house <WH1004> of God <WH430> in company <WH7285>. We: Heb. Who sweetened counsel

Let death <WH4194> seize <WH5377> <WH3451> upon them, and let them go down <WH3381> quick <WH2416> into hell <WH7585>: for wickedness <WH7451> is in their dwellings <WH4033>, and among <WH7130> them. hell: or, the grave
As for me, I will call <WH7121> upon God <WH430>; and the LORD <WH3068> shall save <WH3467> me.
Evening <WH6153>, and morning <WH1242>, and at noon <WH6672>, will I pray <WH7878>, and cry aloud <WH1993>: and he shall hear <WH8085> my voice <WH6963>.
He hath delivered <WH6299> my soul <WH5315> in peace <WH7965> from the battle <WH7128> that was against me: for there were many <WH7227> with me.

God <WH410> shall hear <WH8085>, and afflict <WH6030> them, even he that abideth <WH3427> of old <WH6924>. Selah <WH5542>. Because they have no changes <WH2487>, therefore they fear <WH3372> not God <WH430>. Because: or, With whom also there be no changes, yet they
He hath put forth <WH7971> his hands <WH3027> against such as be at peace <WH7965> with him: he hath broken <WH2490> his covenant <WH1285>. broken: Heb. profaned

The words of his mouth <WH6310> were smoother <WH2505> than butter <WH4260>, but war <WH7128> was in his heart <WH3820>: his words <WH1697> were softer <WH7401> than oil <WH8081>, yet were they drawn swords <WH6609>.
Cast <WH7993> thy burden <WH3053> upon the LORD <WH3068>, and he shall sustain <WH3557> thee: he shall never <WH5769> suffer <WH5414> the righteous <WH6662> to be moved <WH4131>. burden: or, gift

But thou, O God <WH430>, shalt bring them down <WH3381> into the pit <WH875> of destruction <WH7845>: bloody <WH1818> and deceitful <WH4820> men <WH582> shall not live out half <WH2673> their days <WH3117>; but I will trust <WH982> in thee. bloody: Heb. men of bloods and deceit shall: Heb. shall not half their days
